name: sacy
body:
Sacy turns

```html
{asset_compile}
<link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="/styles/file1.css" />
<link type="text/x-sass" rel="stylesheet" href="/styles/file2.sass" />
<link type="text/x-scss" rel="stylesheet" href="/styles/file3.scss" />
<link type="text/x-less" rel="stylesheet" href="/styles/file4.less" />
<script type="text/javascript" src="/jslib/file1.js"></script>
<script type="text/coffeescript" src="/jslib/file2.coffee"></script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="/jslib/file3.js"></script>
{/asset_compile}
```

into

```html
<link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="/assetcache/many-files-1234abc.css" />
<script type="text/javascript" src="/assetcache/many-files-abc123.js"></script>
```

### What is it?
Transform, minify and merge external assets on your page into single, infinitely 
client-side-cacheable files without the hassle of build-script or manual asset
versioning.

All done by a simple Smarty Plugin.

### Download:

Latest release: [0.3.1](https://github.com/downloads/pilif/sacy/sacy-0.3.1.tar.bz2)

Latest prerelease: [0.4-beta1](https://github.com/downloads/pilif/sacy/sacy-0.4-beta1.tar.bz2)

### What's new?

2012-04-30: [Version 0.4-beta1](https://github.com/downloads/pilif/sacy/sacy-0.4-beta1.tar.bz2) has just been released with support for inline-tags.

2012-04-26: [Version 0.3.1](https://github.com/downloads/pilif/sacy/sacy-0.3.1.tar.bz2) has just been released which restores support for PHP 5.2.

note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
